title: cat and mouse
body:
so I was trying to fix the bug again today, and right as I opened chrome devtools it started working properly. I guess the bug got scared away or something.

it only appears when devtools is closed. Just you wait, ill catch you eventually...

title: crushing a bug except i just learn to tolerate it instead
body:
Sometimes the webpage elements fade in really, really slowly instead of quickly like they're supposed to. I have no idea why. Like the setInterval() I'm using to gradually change their opacity is magically running slower or something.

I don't know. I've been trying to debugging this for way too long. I don't know, maybe the answer will be revealed to me in a dream. That somehow has happened before, so who knows. Maybe I'm the chosen one. I don't know. The things I do not know include both the solution to this bug and whether I'll see it in a dream or not. I don't know. am i going insane? idk


if this bug happens please click the area thats not fading in a few times. why does this work? I DONT KNOW!!!!

title: if it works..
body:
I was surprised when I found out that vanilla, library-less javascript didnt have a way to iterate through directories. Or at least I didn't find any. As a language made for websites, I'd imagine it would be pretty helpful to, say, loop through a folder of cat pictures to load onto the website.

..I just ended up keeping a list of file paths to loop through (that I'll have to update by hand whenever a photo is added or removed). If it works it works i guess...

title: javascript is not a strongly typed language
body:
about a week ago I started learning the holy trinity, html css and js, just to make this website. And it's been .. draining.

Especially javascript. I mean, I did like some parts of it, like how much less verbose it feels. ( looking at you, public static void main(String[] args) ) But coming from java, it was really jarring. Like how most of the time it feels like I have no idea what the object I'm working with is. I'll be hovering over the variable, asking (begging) vscode "please, what type is this.. thing im using!?" and all I'll get back is cold silence... and a tooltip that reads "any". Thanks mr ide. Very helpful.
